text:
2. How do I set up literate programming with org-mode and Julia?
- I installed emacs-jupyter on Doom and added the code snippet (org-babel-do-load-languages ...) into my config.el but I get the following errors:
    - 1) When starting a Julia kernel, I get "Requesting kernel info..." that ends with "Kernel did not respond to kernel-info request"
    - 2) When trying out a jupyter-julia org-mode code block, I get "No org-babel-execute function for jupyter-julia!"
- Does emacs-jupyter conflict with julia-repl?

elements.text:
2. How do I set up literate programming with org-mode and Julia?
- I installed emacs-jupyter on Doom and added the code snippet (org-babel-do-load-languages ...) into my config.el but I get the following errors:
    - 1) When starting a Julia kernel, I get "Requesting kernel info..." that ends with "Kernel did not respond to kernel-info request"
    - 2) When trying out a jupyter-julia org-mode code block, I get "No org-babel-execute function for jupyter-julia!"
- Does emacs-jupyter conflict with julia-repl?

text: it’s funny because i remember that exact error, but I don’t know what exactly I did (if anything) that ended up fixing it.

elements.text: it’s funny because i remember that exact error, but I don’t know what exactly I did (if anything) that ended up fixing it.

text: I don’t believe that the packages conflict - was actually just able to get a julia babel source to plot something today

text:
looking through my init.el file, one thing that looks a little different is the additions
```       (org               ; organize your plain life in plain text
        +jupyter
        +roam)```
though I can’t remember if that is a default setting as well..

(org               ; organize your plain life in plain text
